evaluated.description: Style for original data entered by an evaluator.
evaluated.name: evaluated

crossSectionReconstructed.description: Style for pointwise cross sections produced by reconstructing resonance parameters and combining results with background (if any).
crossSectionReconstructed.name: crossSectionReconstructed

angularDistributionReconstructed.description: Style for angular distributions produced by reconstructing resonance parameters.
angularDistributionReconstructed.name: angularDistributionReconstructed

heated.description: Style for cross sections that have been Doppler broadened to account for thermal motion in the target.
heated.name: heated

averageProductData.description: Style for average outgoing product energy and/or momentum data computed from the original (evaluated) distributions.
averageProductData.name: averageProductData

MonteCarlo_cdf.description: Style for data where cumulative probability densities (cdfs) have been pre-computed and stored alongside pdfs for faster Monte Carlo sampling.
MonteCarlo_cdf.name: MonteCarlo_cdf

griddedCrossSection.description: Style for data where all reaction cross sections are put on a union grid for more efficient Monte Carlo sampling.
griddedCrossSection.name: griddedCrossSection

URR_probabilityTables.description: Style for data cross section probability tables were generated for the unresolved resonance region.
URR_probabilityTables.name: URR_probabilityTables

heatedMultiGroup.description: This style specifies parameters used for generating multi-grouped data. Some of the parameters specified include the multi-group boundaries for each particle processed via the \element{transportables} node, and the \element{flux} weight and \element{inverseSpeed} for the projectile.
heatedMultiGroup.name: heatedMultiGroup

SnElasticUpScatter.description: Style for data where a multi-group upscatter correction is applied to elastic scattering.
SnElasticUpScatter.name: SnElasticUpScatter

description: The \element{styles} node contains a list of \element{style} nodes. Each style describes either information about its
evaluated data or information about its processed data. For example, the \element{heated} style (see
Section~\ref{format:styles:heated}) defines cross sections that have been heated (i.e., Doppler broadened) to a
temperature $T$. The following is an example of a \element{heated} style:
\begin{minted}[frame=single,fontsize=\small]{xml}
<heated label="heated1" derivedFrom="..." date="2016-01-01">
<temperature value="600" unit="K"/></heated>
\end{minted}
In this example, all cross section forms (i.e., representations) with their style attribute equal to \attrval{heated1}
have been heated to 600 K on the date 2016-01-01. The \attr{derivedFrom} attribute indicates the style before heating.
In addition, the code that heated the cross sections and its input should be listed under a \code\ element.
styles.name: styles

date.description: A valid date string representing when the data for this style were last released.
date.name: date

label.description: A string identifier for the style and all data assoicated with it. The identifier must be unique among all the styles.
label.name: label

derivedFrom.description: The style that the data assoicated with this style were derived from. For example, multi-group data are often derived from a \element{heated} style.
derivedFrom.name: derivedFrom

library.description: The name of the library for this evaluation (e.g., ``ENDF/B'', ``JEFF'', ``JENDL'').
library.name: library

version.description: The version of this library's release (e.g., ``8.0'', ``3.3'').
version.name: version

projectileEnergyDomain.description: Lower and upper limits of projectile incident energy included in the evaluation.
projectileEnergyDomain.name: projectileEnergyDomain

temperature.description: The temperature the data are evaluated at.
temperature.name: temperature

description: This style denotes evaluated data (i.e., data put in by an evaluator). More than one \element{evaluated} style is allowed.
Each \element{evaluated} style represents a revision of the evaluated data. If a style represents a revision,
its \element{derivedFrom} must point to the prior \element{evaluated} style.
evaluated.name: evaluated

max.description: The maximum projectile energy for the evaluation.
max.name: max

min.description: The minimum projectile energy for the evaluation.
min.name: min

unit.description: The unit for the projectile energy minimum and maximum.
unit.name: unit

description: This element stores the energy domain of the projectile (in the lab frame) along with a unit.
All \element{reaction} nodes in the evaluation should span \textit{at least} this domain, although some may extend past the domain.
projectileEnergyDomain.name: projectileEnergyDomain

description: Specifies the average temperature of the target. In general the `evaluated' style has a temperature of `0 K', while derived data
are Doppler broadened to higher temperature.
temperature.name: temperature

date.description: A valid date string indicating the last time the data for this style were last updated.
date.name: date

label.description: A unique string identifier for the style.
label.name: label

derivedFrom.description: Contains the label of another style from which reconstructed cross sections were derived.  The derivedFrom style is usually `evaluated'.
derivedFrom.name: derivedFrom

temperature.description: The temperature the data are evalauted at.
temperature.name: temperature

crossSectionReconstructed.description: This style denotes cross section data that have been reconstructed from resonance parameters.
crossSectionReconstructed.name: crossSectionReconstructed

date.description: A valid date string indicating the last time the data for this style were last updated.
date.name: date

label.description: A unique string identifier for the style.
label.name: label

derivedFrom.description: Contains the label of another style from which reconstructed angular distribution were derived.  The derivedFrom style is usually `evaluated'.
derivedFrom.name: derivedFrom

temperature.description: The temperature the data are evalauted at.
temperature.name: temperature

angularDistributionReconstructed.description: This style denotes angular distribution data that have been reconstructed from resonance parameters.
angularDistributionReconstructed.name: angularDistributionReconstructed

date.description: A valid date string representing when the data for this style were processed.
date.name: date

derivedFrom.description: The style that the data assoicated with this style were derived from.
derivedFrom.name: derivedFrom

label.description: A string identifier for the style and all data assoicated with it. The identifier must be unique among all the styles.
label.name: label

description: For Coulomb interactions the cross section is infinite due to a singularity at $\mu = 1.0$.
Because of this, a cross section for Coulomb interactions only represents the integral of the $d\sigma(E,\mu)/d\mu$ from $\mu = -1.0$ to \attrval{muCutoff}.
CoulombPlusNuclearElasticMuCutoff.name: CoulombPlusNuclearElasticMuCutoff

date.description: A valid date string representing when the data for this style were processed.
date.name: date

derivedFrom.description: The style that the data assoicated with this style were derived from.
derivedFrom.name: derivedFrom

label.description: A string identifier for the style and all data assoicated with it. The identifier must be unique among all the styles.
label.name: label

temperature.description: The temperature the data for this style were heated to.
temperature.name: temperature

heated.description: This style represents data that have been heated to a particular temperature. For example, cross section may be heated (i.e., Doppler broadened).
heated.name: heated

date.description: A valid date string indicating the last time the data for this style were last updated.
date.name: date

label.description: A unique string identifier for the style.
label.name: label

derivedFrom.description: Contains the label of another style from which reconstructed cross sections were derived.  The derivedFrom style is usually `evaluated'.
derivedFrom.name: derivedFrom

temperature.description: The temperature the data for this style were heated to.
temperature.name: temperature

averageProductData.description: This style signifies data calulated for the \element{averageProductEnergy} and \element{averageProductMomentum} components.
averageProductData.name: averageProductData

date.description: A valid date string representing when the data for this style were processed.
date.name: date

derivedFrom.description: The style that the data assoicated with this style were derived from.
derivedFrom.name: derivedFrom

label.description: A string identifier for the style and all data assoicated with it. The identifier must be unique among all the styles.
label.name: label

description: This style represents data that have distributions processed for use in Monte Carlo transport codes. Distribution $P(\mu,E'|E)$ must be converted

to $P(\mu|E) \times P(E'|E,\mu)$, distribution $P(E',\mu|E)$ must be converted to $P(E'|E) \times P(\mu|E,E')$. Each function1d of $P(E'|E)$, $P(\mu,E)$, $P(E'|E,\mu)$ and $P(\mu|E,E')$ (including the $P(E'|E)$ in Kalbach-Mann) must be a \element{xs\_pdf\_cdf1d} node.
MonteCarlo_cdf.name: MonteCarlo_cdf

date.description: A valid date string representing when the data for this style were processed.
date.name: date

derivedFrom.description: The style that the data assoicated with this style were derived from.
derivedFrom.name: derivedFrom

label.description: A string identifier for the style and all data assoicated with it. The identifier must be unique among all the styles.
label.name: label

grid.description: The common energy grid as used in Monte Carlo transport. See section~\ref{format:gpdc:grid}.
grid.name: grid

griddedCrossSection.description: This style signifies that cross section data have been put on a common energy grid as used in Monte Carlo transport. The grid is given in the \element{grid} child node.
griddedCrossSection.name: griddedCrossSection

date.description: A valid date string representing when the data for this style were processed.
date.name: date

derivedFrom.description: The style that the data assoicated with this style were derived from.
derivedFrom.name: derivedFrom

label.description: A string identifier for the style and all data assoicated with it. The identifier must be unique among all the styles.
label.name: label

transportables.description: Contains a list of \elemlink{transportable} nodes. Each \element{transportable} specifies the multi-group boundaries for a specified particle. There can be at most one \element{transportable} per particle id.
transportables.name: transportables

inverseSpeed.description: The multi-group inverse speeds $v_g$ for group $g$. That is, $v_g = \int_g dE \, f(E) / v(E)$, where $E$ is the projectile's energy, $f(E)$ is a flux, $v(E)$ is the projectile's velocity and the integral is over group $g$.
inverseSpeed.name: inverseSpeed

description: This style represents data that have been heated and multi-grouped. The temperature is inherited from the \attr{derivedFrom} lineage.
The multi-group boundaries are specified under a \elemlink{transportables} node. The flux, which can be at a temperature relevant for the reaction data,
is specified by the \element{flux} child node.
heatedMultiGroup.name: heatedMultiGroup

transportable.description: Each \elemlink{transportable} specifies multi-group parameters for each particle processed for multi-group transport.
transportable.name: transportable

transportables.description: Contains a list of particles (i.e., \elemlink{transportable} nodes) for which multi-group processing was performed. Each particle's id is specified via the \attr{label} attribute which must be unique for each transportable.
transportables.name: transportables

conserve.description: Defines the outgoing particle's energy weight used when calculating a product's transfer matrices. Allowed values are \attrval{number} with a weight of 1 and \attrval{energy} with a weight of the product's outgoing energy.
conserve.name: conserve

multiGroup.description: Contains the multi-group boundaries for the specified particle.
multiGroup.name: multiGroup

transportable.description: Contains a particle id and its associated multi-group boundaries.
transportable.name: transportable

label.description: An identifier for the multi-group boundaries.
label.name: label

grid.description: The axes information for the multi-group boundaries. See Section~\ref{format:gpdc:grid}. The grid values are the multi-group boundaries.
grid.name: grid

multiGroup.description: Contains a multi-group identifier and its multi-group boundaries.
multiGroup.name: multiGroup

label.description: An identifier string for the flux.
label.name: label

description: The flux $f(E,\mu)$.
The axes are incident particle energy, Legendre order and flux. See section~\ref{format:gpdc:XYs2d}.
XYs2d.name: XYs2d

flux.description: For \element{heatedMultiGroup} data, this node specifies the flux used to multi-group the data.
flux.name: flux

gridded1d.description: Contains the inverse speeds for each group (group boundaries are listed in the \element{multiGroup} ancestor).
gridded1d.name: gridded1d

inverseSpeed.description: The multi-group inverse speeds $v_g$ for group $g$. That is, $v_g = \int_g dE \, f(E) / v(E)$ where $E$ is the projectile's energy, $f(E)$ is a flux, $v(E)$ the projectile's velocity and the integral is over group $g$.
inverseSpeed.name: inverseSpeed

date.description: A valid date string representing when the data for this style were processed.
date.name: date

derivedFrom.description: The style that the data assoicated with this style were derived from.
derivedFrom.name: derivedFrom

label.description: A string identifier for the style and all data assoicated with it. The identifier must be unique among all the styles.
label.name: label

upperCalculatedGroup.description: Index of the highest-energy group (counting from 0) impacted by the upscatter correction.
upperCalculatedGroup.name: upperCalculatedGroup

SnElasticUpScatter.description: Like style \element{heatedMultiGroup} but with an upscatter correction included for elastic scattering.
SnElasticUpScatter.name: SnElasticUpScatter

date.description: A valid date string representing when the data for this style were processed.
date.name: date

derivedFrom.description: The style that the data assoicated with this style were derived from.
derivedFrom.name: derivedFrom

label.description: A string identifier for the style and all data assoicated with it. The identifier must be unique among all the styles.
label.name: label

URR_probabilityTables.description: Indicates that cross section probability tables ($P(\sigma | E)$) were generated for use in Monte Carlo transport.
URR_probabilityTables.name: URR_probabilityTables

date.description: A valid date string representing when the data for this style were processed.
date.name: date

derivedFrom.description: The style that the data assoicated with this style were derived from.
derivedFrom.name: derivedFrom

label.description: A string identifier for the style and all data assoicated with it. The identifier must be unique among all the styles.
label.name: label

sigmaZeros.description: Contains a list of `sigma-0' values at which Bondarko factors were computed.
sigmaZeros.name: sigmaZeros

Bondarenko.description: Data style for Bondarenko self-shielding factors for deterministic transport.
Bondarenko.name: Bondarenko

values.description: List of sigma-zero values (stored as Float64).
values.name: values

sigmaZeros.description: Data style for Bondarenko self-shielding factors for deterministic transport.
sigmaZeros.name: sigmaZeros

date.description: A valid date string representing when the data for this style were processed.
date.name: date

derivedFrom.description: The style that the data assoicated with this style were derived from.
derivedFrom.name: derivedFrom

label.description: A string identifier for the style and all data assoicated with it. The identifier must be unique among all the styles.
label.name: label

numberOfBands.description: Integer for the number of bands per group.
numberOfBands.name: numberOfBands

multiBand.description: Data style for a proposed alternative to Bondarenko factors for self-shielding in deterministic transport.
multiBand.name: multiBand

date.description: A valid date string representing when the data for this style were processed.
date.name: date

derivedFrom.description: The style that the data assoicated with this style were derived from.
derivedFrom.name: derivedFrom

label.description: A string identifier for the style and all data assoicated with it. The identifier must be unique among all the styles.
label.name: label

numberOfBins.description: Integer for the number of equal-probable bins.
numberOfBins.name: numberOfBins

equalProbableBins.description: Style for distributions that have been converted to equal-probable bins for faster Monte Carlo sampling.
equalProbableBins.name: equalProbableBins

date.description: A valid date string representing when the data for this style were processed.
date.name: date

derivedFrom.description: The style that the data assoicated with this style were derived from.
derivedFrom.name: derivedFrom

label.description: A string identifier for the style and all data assoicated with it. The identifier must be unique among all the styles.
label.name: label

realization.description: Style indicating that data were generated by randomly sampling from a covariance matrix, e.g. for uncertainty quantification.
realization.name: realization
